title: Make a sauce, save summer, cut food waste — all with the push of a button
text:
By Bonnie S. Benwick July 24 at 3:13 PM Follow @bonniebenwick
Take your old kitchen friend for a spin this weekend — and I don’t mean for piña coladas. (From Greenfield/Belser Ltd.) I haven’t had to pack a kid’s lunchbox since Annie Lennox was walking on broken glass, but the current onslaught of back-to-school advertising is making even me anxious. One antidote, I think, waits at the end of my counter.
I’m going to plug in my blender, fill it with a few savory ingredients and make a dressing for the cabbage I’ll be grilling this weekend; that will help keep the rest of summer in focus. Or I might puree fresh mint with fruit that’s just a bit overripe, to make a sauce for morning yogurt. Between the season’s glorious produce and what’s on hand, I bet a quick and happy union is only a few strokes of a chef’s knife and a few push buttons away.
[More Weekend Kitchen: How the French really eat ; must-bring things for vacationing .]
That’s not just foodwriterspeak. I’m talking about using the blender to make a fast and easy accompaniment, and to capture and mix the last bit of goodness found in a squeeze bottle. Think of the appliance as another way to repurpose foods you might have tossed. Check out the blender-friendly recipes listed below; when you search for “blender” in our Recipe Finder , you’ll discover many more.
But first . . .
Top recipes of the week There are the makings of a fine summer feast in these dishes most viewed online in our database of tested recipes . And thanks to those of you who take the time to rate those recipes:
1. Shrimp Creole (Camarones Enchilados) . A Plate Lab winner from chef David Guas that draws on his Cuban heritage.
2. Fusilli With Corn Sauce . How you scrape off the kernels makes all the difference, from Joe Yonan .
3. Dorie Greenspan’s Blueberry Pie. Easy crust, with a secret for non-weepy filling.
4. Chard-Wrapped Cod With Sun-Dried Tapenade . Ellie Krieger’s surefire method for keeping fish moist on the grill.
5. Smoked Corn and Black Bean Salad . A summer ante, from Smoke Signals columnist Jim Shahin.
